subject: Re: [junit] how do i start using Junit
msgSnippet: ... I did translate most of the Test Infected example in French and added a few minor changes to make it working for my students. People interested in can
messageBody:
Andoni O'Conchubhair wrote:

> Check out: http://junit.sourceforge.net/
>
> And try working through the "Test Infected" example. It has one or two
> major errors/omissions so when it doesn't work for you don't get angry (as I
> did) just come back to the list and get help. I'll send you my copy of part
> one of this code if you like?


I did translate most of the "Test Infected" example in
French and added a few minor changes to make it working
for my students.

People interested in can take a look at it at:
http://www.cril.univ-artois.fr/~leberre/MI3/TESTING/junit3.7/doc/testinfected/ntesting_fr.htm

The translation is not perfect, but it might be
of some help for someone else ;-=)

The code (pretty-printed in HTML) is also available at
http://www.cril.univ-artois.fr/~leberre/MI3/TESTING/junit3.7/doc/testinfected/Somme.java.html
http://www.cril.univ-artois.fr/~leberre/MI3/TESTING/junit3.7/doc/testinfected/Sac.java.html
http://www.cril.univ-artois.fr/~leberre/MI3/TESTING/junit3.7/doc/testinfected/SommeTest.java.html



Daniel

--
Daniel Le Berre mailto:leberre@...-artois.fr
Maitre de Conferences, CRIL, Universite d'Artois
http://www.cril.univ-artois.fr/~leberre
